definition: summit/apex/pinnacle (of one's career etc)/peak (of a civilization etc)
summit
(of a mountain) high and tapered peak or summit/mountain-like in appearance/highest level/classifier for camels
old variant of 峰[feng1]

sentences.english: Soul of a force on the storm, swept the continent magic peak.
sentences.chinese: 一切关于魂力的风暴，席卷大陆的幻术巅峰。

sentences.english: Life has its ups and downs, its peaks and its valleys.
sentences.chinese: 人生也有兴衰起伏，也有巅峰和深谷。

sentences.english: The altissima triumph is smile on the zenith of destiny.
sentences.chinese: 唯一所祈求的胜利，仅是站在命运的巅峰，微笑。

sentences.english: Jiang Wen is at the top of the world - the world of Chinese cinema, that is.
sentences.chinese: 姜文登上了中国电影界的巅峰。

sentences.english: You couldn've chopped me into confetti by now if you were in tip-top condition.
sentences.chinese: 你现在这个“巅峰”状态可没法把我切成糖果。

sentences.english: I believe I HAsn't reached the summit of my care noter.
sentences.chinese: 我相信我还么有达到事业的巅峰。

sentences.english: They mean that you’re past your best and are now in decline.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着你已经过了你的巅峰时期现在在走下坡路。

sentences.english: They need water to stay hydrated, and to stay in peak physical condition.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要补充水分，需要保持身体的巅峰状态。

sentences.english: Soul of a force on the storm, Swept the continent magic peak.
sentences.chinese: 壹场有关魂力地风暴，席卷大陆的幻术巅峰。

sentences.english: Longfor Century uses unique architectural language and paramount height.
sentences.chinese: 龙湖世纪以独特的建筑语言和巅峰高度。

sentences.english: He had always managed to lead his team to victory and had never lost a game.
sentences.chinese: 他屡屡率领他的球队登上巅峰，从未输过一场比赛。

sentences.english: To keep yourself in peak deep throat condition, do step three everyday.
sentences.chinese: 为了使自己保持在深喉的巅峰状态，每天练习第三步。

sentences.english: Loose Melody of Yuan Dynasty reflected their indulgent enjoyment and topmost life experiences.
sentences.chinese: 《全元散曲》反映了他们的沉醉的生活与巅峰体验。

sentences.english: Yuhuangding, Mount Tai's highest peak, stands over deep valleys and above other perilous peaks.
sentences.chinese: 其巅峰玉皇顶为峡谷和险峰所环绕。

sentences.english: The release of jMaki 1.0 is a culmination of a lot of hard work and time by the community.
sentences.chinese: 0的发布是社区花费了大量时间和精力的巅峰之作。

sentences.english: Moreover, he pushed the Cavendish to the peak in it's history .
sentences.chinese: 从而把卡文迪什推上了其历史发展的巅峰。

definition: peak/summit/fig. high point/masterpiece
variant of 巔峰|巅峰[dian1 feng1]
lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
flourishing period/golden age
to reach great heights (in technical skills or scholastic achievements)
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
to surpass/to exceed/to transcend
valley/trough (as opposed to peaks)/fig. low point/lowest ebb/nadir of one's fortunes
flourishing/at its peak/a golden age
boundary/state/realm
flourishing age (of the ceremonial tripod)/golden age
top-notch/first-rate
level (of achievement etc)/standard/level (surveying)
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
to be shoulder to shoulder/to be on an equal level with/Taiwan pr. [bi4 jian1]
to go downhill/to decline/to slump
